summary: This is an email chain from March 16, 2020, among members of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York. They discuss postponing a meeting with an attorney (likely for a defendant or witness in the Epstein case) due to the COVID-19 pandemic and scheduling a conference call to discuss the status of the case and how to proceed with investigative work during the delay.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the main email, an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, coordinates with the task force about postponing a meeting with an attorney and scheduling a status call for the case.

events.title: Task Force Meeting Postponement Discussion
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force to postpone a meeting with an attorney scheduled for the next day, citing office direction to limit meetings due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and proposes a conference call to discuss case status.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from March 16, 2020, discussing the Epstein case investigation.
The correspondence involves the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
A meeting with an attorney (likely for a defendant or witness) is postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, indicating the pandemic's impact on the investigation timeline.
The team plans to use the delay for additional investigative work like research, memos, 302s (FBI interview reports), and reviewing search warrant results.
The email chain shows the operational coordination within the law enforcement team handling the case during a period of disruption.
